meanings.definition: Capable of hardening or becoming hardened.
meanings.sent1: The indurative clay dried into a solid brick.
meanings.sent2: The cold weather made the ground indurative and difficult to dig.
meanings.sent3: The indurative ice cream was impossible to scoop.
meanings.sent4: Her indurative determination turned obstacles into stepping stones.
meanings.sent5: The indurative rock stood strong against the crashing waves.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to form a hard mass.
meanings.sent1: The indurative resin quickly solidified into a strong material.
meanings.sent2: The indurative mixture hardened into a durable structure.
meanings.sent3: The indurative playdough was tough to mold.
meanings.sent4: His indurative resolve formed an unbreakable bond.
meanings.sent5: The indurative metal sculpture gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Causing something to become hard or solid.
meanings.sent1: The indurative process transformed the soft clay into pottery.
meanings.sent2: The indurative substance solidified the liquid into a rigid form.
meanings.sent3: The indurative spell turned the marshmallow into a rock.
meanings.sent4: His indurative words cemented their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The indurative frost coated the leaves in a crystalline layer.
